newwalet faq1_q_0: What is the different between Default and Modern Adddresses?
newwalet faq1_a_0:
Default Addresses are accepted by all wallets.
With modern Addresses sending Bitcoins is cheaper but not all wallets accept them.
newwalet faq1_q0: Can I come up with my own 24 words?
newwalet faq1_a0: No. The 24 words are generated according to a Bitcoin standard procedure
newwalet faq1_q1: What are the secrets words and why do I need 24?
newwalet faq1_a1:
The secrets words, also known as Mnemonic, along with the password, is what is needed to access your bitcoins.
There are mnemonics with less than 24 words but 24 words are more secure
newwalet faq1_q2: Why are my secrets words fill up for me?
newwalet faq1_a2: {name} generates randomly 24 words following a standar Bitcoin procedure, but you are free to enter your own 24 words from other wallet
newwalet faq1_q3: Where and how are the secret words stored?
newwalet faq1_a3:
The 24 secret words are encrypted on the browser using your password and then saved in our database.
When you need to send bitcoins, the encrypted 24 words are decrypted in the browser using your wallet password and at that moment the private keys are generated to send the bitcoins
When you save the wallet, a pdf with mnemonic and wallet password will be generated. You must keep it safe cause anyone accessing it can get your bitcoins
newwalet faq1_q4: Who is responsible for safekeeing these 24 secret words?
newwalet faq1_a4:
You are responsible to keep these 24 words and the password (see below).
But as explained above, {name} keeps an ecnrypted copy for your convience.
newwallet_faq2_a1: The combination of the 24 secret words and the password is what is needed to send bitcoins.
newwallet_faq2_q2: How is the wallet password different from my 24 secret words?
newwallet_faq2_a2: 24 secret words and password work as a team to protect your bitcoins.
newwallet_faq2_a3:
Your password is not stored in {name}.
It's on the pdf generated when saving the wallet.
It's your responsibility to keep it safe.
If you lose your password you have lost access to the bitcoins in your wallet.
newwallet_faq2_q4: Who is responsible for safekeeping my passwword?
newwallet_faq2_a4: You are solely responsible to keep/remember the wallet password.
ln_faq_a1:
It's a solution that runs above the bitcoin blockchain that allows Lightning Payments and almost free.
Cryptographically as secure as Bitcoin though it adds more configuration and maintenance complexity that {name} makes transparent for its users.
ln_faq_a2: Bapp offers Lihgtning service 100% non-custodial to it's uses.
ln_faq_q3: What is the difference between a wallet and Lightning?
ln_faq_a3:
Lightning works similar to a prepaid service.
You send in advance some bitcoins to lightning and then spend them as you need it.
ln_faq_q4: How safe is my money in Bapp Lightning service?
ln_faq_a4: Your money is as protected as in an individual Lightning installation, with a 2 of 2 multisignature between you and Bapp.
ln_faq_q5: when will Bapp Lightning service be online?
ln_faq_a5: Bapp Lightning service is already developed and it will be offered to Bapp users soon when testing is complete.
